result.execSummary:
The defendant James Kenneth Degenaer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Kenneth Degenaer in court. Statement by Court. Court recess 2:33pm. Court recalled 2:38pm. State moves court to amend 22CM15 to county ordinance of DC. Court amends to county ordinance upon motion of State. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds defendant guilty due to no contest plea, imposes $500 fine all inclusive, 60 days to pay or commitment order. 
22CM26 - State moves to dismiss count 1, amend count 2 to county ordinance violation of disorderly conduct. Court dismisses count 1 upon State's motion and amends count 2. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds defendant guilty due to no contest plea, impose $500 fine all inclusive, 60 days to pay or commitment order. Adj. 2:42pm jjm

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Kenneth Degenaer in court. Court calls 22cm15 & 22cm26. Court reads criminal complaint. Defendant wants attorney. Court advises defendant to contact PD's office, if doesn't qualify file request for court appointed attorney. Court continues bond in both cases. Adj. 10:19am jjm
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
